programme.desc: The legendary indie film that launched the career of Kevin Smith and won over audiences with its raw energy, outrageous comedy, and a hip soundtrack. CLERKS features razor-sharp wit and the debut of pop-culture icons Jay and Silent Bob.

programme.title: Chasing Amy, (1997, Romantic comedy)
programme.desc: Cult comic-book artist Holden falls head-over-heals with fellow artist Alyssa, but for that love to live, he'll need to contend with his disapproving best friend Banky, her sexuality, and his own misgivings about himself in this Kevin Smith classic.

programme.title: Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back, (2001, Screwball)
programme.desc: The comic "Bluntman and Chronic" is adapted for the big-screen by Hollywood without the permission of the real-life stoner icons of CLERKS— Jay and Silent Bob.

programme.title: Clerks, (1994, Comedy)
programme.desc: The legendary indie film that launched the career of Kevin Smith and won over audiences with its raw energy, outrageous comedy, and a hip soundtrack. CLERKS features razor-sharp wit and the debut of pop-culture icons Jay and Silent Bob.

programme.title: Chasing Amy, (1997, Romantic comedy)
programme.desc: Cult comic-book artist Holden falls head-over-heals with fellow artist Alyssa, but for that love to live, he'll need to contend with his disapproving best friend Banky, her sexuality, and his own misgivings about himself in this Kevin Smith classic.

programme.title: The Harder They Come, (1972, Action)
programme.desc: Reggae legend Jimmy Cliff stars as Ivan Martin, an aspiring singer hoping to make a name for himself. Robbed of his money and possessions, he finds work with a self-righteous preacher

programme.title: Annie Hall, (1977, Romantic comedy)
programme.desc: Woody Allen is in prime form in this celebrated comedy and 1977 Best Picture Oscar®-winner in which he portrays a highly neurotic comedy writer who falls head-over-heels in love with a naive small-town girl (Diane Keaton) who aspires to be a singer.

programme.title: Foul Play, (1978, Romantic comedy)
programme.desc: Beware of the Dwarf, whispers the hitchhiker to the beautiful librarian as he dies through a screening of This Gun Is Mine. Suddenly, Hawn is propelled into a world of wild chases and deadly encounters with an assortment of weird characters.

programme.title: Heaven Can Wait, (1978, Comedy)
programme.desc: Heaven Can Wait is a romantic fantasy about Joe Pendleton, a Los Angeles Rams quarterback who is accidentally summoned to Heaven by an overly zealous celestial escort.

programme.title: Harold and Maude, (1971, Romantic comedy)
programme.desc: A classic cult film that features one of the screen's most unlikely pairs. It will defy everything you've ever seen or known about screen lovers.

programme.title: Sunday, Bloody Sunday, (1971, Drama)
programme.desc: In this groundbreaking and provocative drama, Glenda Jackson and Peter Finch portray two Londoners coping with the noncommittal affections of the free-spirited lover (Murray Head) they have in common. John Schlesinger directs.

programme.title: Foul Play, (1978, Romantic comedy)
programme.desc: Beware of the Dwarf, whispers the hitchhiker to the beautiful librarian as he dies through a screening of This Gun Is Mine. Suddenly, Hawn is propelled into a world of wild chases and deadly encounters with an assortment of weird characters.

programme.title: Heaven Can Wait, (1978, Comedy)
programme.desc: Heaven Can Wait is a romantic fantasy about Joe Pendleton, a Los Angeles Rams quarterback who is accidentally summoned to Heaven by an overly zealous celestial escort.

programme.title: Harold and Maude, (1971, Romantic comedy)
programme.desc: A classic cult film that features one of the screen's most unlikely pairs. It will defy everything you've ever seen or known about screen lovers.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Mai gains control of Marik's The Winged Dragon of Ra, but she's unable to decipher how to unleash its massively powerful abilities. Can Mai solve the mystery of the Egyptian God Card before Marik solves it himself?
programme.sub-title: Mind Game Part 3: Mai vs. Marik

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: In the fourth duel of the Battle City finals, Kaiba's mystery opponent is Ishizu. With the power of her Millennium Necklace, Ishizu can see the future, including every card Kaiba is planning to play.
programme.sub-title: A Duel with Destiny Part 1: Kaiba vs. Ishizu

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Ishizu, using the magic of her Millennium Necklace, has already seen the outcome of the duel: she will defeat Kaiba with sacrifice's blast! How can Kaiba win when it's predestined that he will lose? Kaiba must change the future!
programme.sub-title: A Duel with Destiny Part 2: Kaiba vs. Ishizu

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: As Marik's evil grows, Ishizu reveals the secrets of her bloodline: How did Marik transform from a kind child into a power-hungry tyrant out for world domination? Can Yugi save Marik from the edge of darkness, or is he already beyond salvation?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: With their previous pact broken, Bakura duels Marik for the right to control the Millennium Rod and Millennium Ring, with the loser being trapped inside the Shadow Realm forever. To tip the odds, Bakura gains an unexpected ally… another Marik?
programme.sub-title: Showdown in the Shadows Part 1: Marik Vs. Bakura

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Bakura and good Marik summon The Winged Dragon of Ra, ready to blast and banish evil Marik into the Shadow Realm. But The Winged Dragon of Ra has more than one special ability, and evil Marik knows how to use them all.
programme.sub-title: Showdown in the Shadows Part 2: Marik Vs. Bakura

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Kaiba's blimp is hijacked by a mysterious boy named Noah and his henchmen - five familiar foes from Yugi and Kaiba's past who are out for revenge!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The first to duel under the all-new Deck Master System is Yugi against Big 1 Gansley's Deepsea Warrior! Can Yugi master the complex new rules, or will the rules master him?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: As Yugi struggles to make heads or tails of the Deck Master System, Big 1 uses his Deck Master ability to send all of Yugi's attacks right back! How can Yugi defeat an opponent when his attacks take away his own life points?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi's running out of life points, but can his cute little Deck Master Kuriboh unleash his furry fury to turn the tide of battle?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Prepare for a feathered fight when Téa squares off against Big 2 Crump's Nightmare Penguin where the loser will be trapped forever in a block of ice!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: As Téa's body turns more and more into a giant popsicle, can she keep her brain from freezing to find a way to melt Big 2's strategy? Or will Big 2's penguin horde waddle all over her?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey squares off against the judicial jerk Big 3 Johnson who takes the Deck Master form of Judge Man! How can Joey defeat a foe who can destroy Joey's monsters at will?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Just when Joey seems to gain the upper hand, he hits the longest streak of bad luck in the history of mankind! Has Joey's fortunes finally run out, or is a crooked judge ignoring the rules of the law?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Big 4 Nezbitt challenges Duke, Tristan, and Serenity for the right to gain control of three bodies at once! Will Serenity's errors cost her team the ultimate price when Tristan and Duke can't cover for her mistakes?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: One down, two to go! With the loss of Tristan, Serenity is heartbroken. Can she pull herself together and remember the lessons Tristan taught her to turn the duel around?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Tristan's back... but he's not who he appears to be when he kidnaps Mokuba! It's time for Kaiba to stop monkeying around and rescue his brother, but he's confronted by Big 5 Leichter!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Big 5's Satellite Cannon attacks Kaiba's monsters from deep space! Mokuba's unwavering faith in Kaiba inspires him to believe that his brother will pull out the victory, but Noah has plans to ruin their brotherhood...

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Kaiba arrives at Noah's sanctuary to rescue Mokuba, but Mokuba wants to stay with Noah! Has Mokuba seen the evil within Kaiba, or is something more sinister in the works?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Noah gives the Big Five one last chance to redeem themselves in a five-on-two tag team duel where Yugi and Joey take on the entire Big Five!
programme.sub-title: Merger of the Big Five, Part 1

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The Big Five concentrate their attack on Joey so that Yugi would be forced to duel all alone! Outmanned and overpowered, Yugi and Joey are near the end of the line!
programme.sub-title: Merger of the Big Five, Part 2

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The Big Five summon an almighty dragon that previously defeated Joey, Mai, and Mokuba! Joey and Yugi pull out all the stops, but is that enough to avoid their minds being scattered over virtual reality?
programme.sub-title: Merger of the Big Five, Part 3

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: It's a duel for control of KaibaCorp when Noah squares off against Kaiba! But can Kaiba fight at full strength after he learns the hidden truth about Noah... and the tragic past that made him what he is today?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Noah's Shinato's Ark steals monsters into its keep to use as an impenetrable wall of servants! How can Kaiba hurt Noah when Noah has an endless stream of monsters to protect himself with?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Kaiba's about to finish Noah, but Mokuba protects Noah from his final blow! Will Kaiba sacrifice his beloved brother in exchange for freedom, or will the brotherly bond remain unbreakable?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: For every turn that passes, one of Yugi's friends is transformed into stone! As more and more of his friends harden into solid rock, can Yugi defeat Noah before he runs out of turns and transforms into stone himself?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi's friends are petrified into solid stone statues, but their spirits live on! Their combined souls energize Yugi into a noble fight, but is spirit going to win the duel when Yugi's not drawing the right cards?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi has defeated Noah... but they still can't escape from the virtual world! The real reason behind their entrapment is revealed... as is the true villain pulling the strings!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: As Kaiba squares off against his stepfather Gozaburo for their final battle, Yugi and friends are attacked by endless hordes of monsters! Their only hope is Noah, but they can't expect help from their enemy... can they?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Time is almost up before the missile's explosion destroys Yugi and friends! Will the Battle City finalists beat the clock and live to duel another day in the stunning conclusion to the virtual world saga!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi and friends arrive at KaibaCorp Island where the Battle City finalists will compete in the ultimate dueling arena! Get ready for the awesome four-person battle royal where any duelist can attack anyone else!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Honor, friendship, revenge... As each duelist remembers what they're fighting for, the battle royal rages on where none of the duelists know where the next attack is going to come from!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey may have fought some of the fiercest fights in Battle City, but has all his training taught him to become an elite duelist? Joey's gonna show what he's made of in the conclusion to the four-man battle royal!

programme.title: Ace and Luffy’s happy reunion is crudely interrupted by the Billions of Baroque Works. They may be outnumbered, but these brothers are no ordinary pirates!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Ace and Luffy! Hot Emotions and Brotherly Bonds!

programme.title: Before they can start their trek across the desert, Luffy and the Straw Hats are stopped at the shore by the cute – but formidable – Kung Fu Dugongs.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Erumalu, the City of Green and the Kung Fu Dugongs!

programme.title: Luffy’s crew encounters treacherous birds and man-eating foliage on its desert odyssey, and just when they think the coast is clear, a great disturbance emerges from beneath the sand!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Adventure in the Country of Sand! The Monsters that Live in the Scorching Land!

programme.title: The Straw Hats cross paths with the Barbar Sand Pirates, and Ace runs into big trouble when he gets separated from the group.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Enter the Desert Pirates! The Men Who Live Freely!

programme.title: Princess Vivi devises a plan to test the hearts of a gang of so-called rebels. They talk a good game, but will their bite measure up to their bark?
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: False Fortitude! Camu, Rebel Soldier at Heart!

programme.title: The Straw Hats continue their journey to Yuba, where a bittersweet reunion with a childhood friend awaits Princess Vivi.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Rebel Warrior Koza! The Dream vowed to Vivi!

programme.title: Fire Fist Ace is hired by two young boys to hunt down and capture a lethal bounty hunter known only as the Scorpion.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Showdown in a Heat Haze! Ace vs. the Gallant Scorpion!

programme.title: Chopper, Zoro, and Luffy get separated from the others. When the heat makes Luffy act even stranger than usual, his friends wonder if they joined the right pirate gang.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Ruins and Lost Ways! Vivi, Her Friends and the Country's Form!

programme.title: The assassins of Baroque Works gather at Spider’s Café, and the Straw Hats arrive at Yuba only to find it buried in sand.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Spiders Caf? at 8 o'Clock! The Enemy Leaders Gather!

programme.title: Crocodile reveals himself to the Baroque Works assassins and discloses his dastardly plan for Alabasta. After departing Yuba, Luffy takes a stand that forces Vivi to rethink her mission.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Luffy vs. Vivi! The Tearful Vow to Put Friends on the Line

programme.title: Vivi takes Luffy’s advice, and the Straw Hats head towards Rainbase for a confrontation with Crocodile. Karoo finally reaches the palace with Vivi’s warning for King Cobra.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Battlefront of Alabasta! Rainbase, the City of Dreams

programme.title: Luffy leads a daring – but foolish – raid on Crocodile’s casino. His poor planning lands him behind bars with Captain Smoker – and more importantly, leaves Vivi unprotected.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Trap of Certain Defeat! Storming Raindinners!

programme.title: While the Straw Hats are stuck in the clink, King Cobra addresses the starving people of Nanohana. Will his unbelievable revelation drive his subjects past the brink of rebellion?
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Operation Utopia Commences! The Swell of Rebellion Stirs!

programme.title: A royal imposter has the rebel army hell-bent on bringing Cobra’s reign to a violent end. Meanwhile, Luffy and his mates find themselves in deep trouble and even deeper water.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Terrifying Banana Gators and Mr. Prince!

programme.title: Sanji shows up in the nick of time to make the crocs cough up the key to Luffy’s freedom, but the ravenous reptiles spit up something else instead.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Key to a Great Comeback Escape! The Wax-Wax Ball!

programme.title: Crocodile snatches Vivi off the back of a giant crab, but Luffy’s not having it. The rubber-man goes toe-to-toe with the sandman in a battle that will end in bloodshed.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Merciless Mortal Combat! Luffy vs Crocodile

programme.title: Crocodile puts Luffy down for a never-ending dirt nap, and the Straw Hats get a lift from a crabby ally in their race to stop the looming rebellion.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Dash For a Miracle! Alabasta Animal Land

programme.title: Vivi arrives in Alubarna with just enough time to stop the rebellion, but the agents of Baroque Works lurk in every corner, waiting to sabotage her plans for peace.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Rebel Army vs. Royal Army! Showdown at Alubarna

programme.title: Sanji buys Vivi some time by mixing it up with a foe of many faces. Outside Alubarna’s walls, Chopper and Usopp tangle with Miss Merry Christmas and her slugging sidekick.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Alubarna Grieves! The Fierce Captain Karoo

programme.title: Usopp finally shows some courage by using a five-ton hammer to play whack-a-mole with Miss Merry Christmas. He may be bluffing, but the distraction lets Chopper zero in on the enemy’s weakness.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Sworn on a Friend's Dream! The Battle of Molehill, Block 4

programme.title: Chopper’s Rumble Ball could be the difference between life and death in the mole ballgame. Elsewhere, Sanji has trouble kicking a pretty enemy, and Vivi proposes something unthinkable.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Big Opening Day Today! The Copy-Copy Montage

programme.title: Vivi continues preparations to blow up the palace; Zorro puts his steel to the test against a lethal blade-man; Sanji tries to overcome his inability to kick a foxy lady!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Transformed into Nami! Bon Clay's Rapid-Fire Ballet Kenpo!

programme.title: Things don’t look good for the prettiest Straw Hat. Nami’s about to tangle with a thorny adversary, and the weapon Usopp built her is only good for party tricks!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Nami's Cyclone Advisory! Clima Tact Burst!

programme.title: Crocodile reveals his sinister motives for attacking Alabasta, and Nami tries to end her duel with Miss Doublefinger by unleashing the Clima Tact’s ultimate weapon: a devastatingly lethal tornado!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Secret Passed Down In The Royal Family! The Ancient Weapon Pluton!

programme.title: Zoro hopes to attain a new level of strength when he fights a foe with a body made of blades. The Straw Hat sword-slinger is determined to become a man who can cut steel – or die trying.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Secret Of Powerful Swordplay! Ability To Cut Steel And The Rhythm Things Have!

programme.title: Koza – the leader of the rebel army – finally discovers the evil mastermind behind Alabasta’s drought, but is he too late to prevent further bloodshed?
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Battle is Over! Koza Raises the White Flag!

programme.title: When Koza is mysteriously shot, the rebellion is reborn, but Vivi’s cries for a cease-fire fall on deaf ears until a long-overdue hero swoops to the rescue!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Where Vivi's Voice Gets Heard! The Hero Descends!

programme.title: Luffy finally discovers the secret to knocking out a sandman, but it won’t matter unless Vivi and the rest of the Straw Hats can locate the Baroque Works bomber.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Sand Croc and Water Luffy!... The Second Round of the Duel!

programme.title: While his mates search for a bomb, Luffy narrowly survives his second scrape with Crocodile. Across town, Nico Robin strong-arms Cobra into revealing his country’s greatest secret.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: That Looks Croc-ish!... Luffy, Run to the Royal Tomb!

programme.title: With the walls crumbling down around them, Crocodile attacks Luffy with a poisoned pirate hook. Meanwhile, Vivi draws a bead on the bombers, but can she stop them in time?
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Nightmare Draws Near!... This is the Sand-Sand Clan's Secret Base

programme.title: The Straw Hats team up to give Vivi one last shot at disarming the bomb that threatens to destroy her city. She succeeds in cutting the fuse, but Crocodile has a backup plan.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Magnificent Wings! My Name is Pell, Guardian Deity of the Country

programme.title: Pell’s sacrifice spares his beloved city, but only an act of god can stop the rebellion. With Crocodile’s poison coursing through his body, Luffy musters a final attack against Alabasta’s oppressor.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: I Will Surpass You! Rain Falls in Alabasta.

programme.title: Crocodile is defeated, the rain has returned to Alabasta, and Vivi’s people are eager to rebuild their kingdom. As for the Straw Hats, they have a fleet of marines breathing down their necks.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A Farewell to Arms! Pirates and Different Ideas of Justice!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: As usual, Lupin is tossed to and fro by Fujiko. But a man named Buckingham comes to him and sells him "disguise chewing gum" for 50,000 dollars.
programme.sub-title: The Strategy of the Chewing Gum Disguise

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The island of Rabaul has many remains of Japanese casualties of the Pacific War. It's said that Captain Cook's secret treasure is hidden there, worth 1-billion pounds. Lupin and gang are after this treasure but they get attacked!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin and gang break into the Bank of Stockholm but as usual, Fujiko tries to take the money all for herself. Lupin goes after her but she gets injured in an avalanche. She confesses to Lupin about the location of her most precious treasure…

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin and friends search a month for the pirate Kid's treasure, but they are thwarted by an underground organization called the Red Ghost. Knowing something is afoot, Lupin sends Fujiko and Goemon to investigate.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin finds a piece of paper in a silk hat, an heirloom of Arsène Lupin. It's information regarding an opal statue of Venus, and since Lupin figures its ownership is his birthright, he heads to Gregoire's castle.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Zenigata acquires a pie-throwing gun, and is ordered to capture Lupin. Meanwhile, Lupin and Fujiko are discussing Napoleon's treasures. It's said that the key to solving the mystery of their whereabouts lies in a scarf made by Napoleon's assistant…
programme.sub-title: An Unusual End to an Expedition for Napoleon's Treasure

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The young girl Francoise lives near Lupin; she watches Lupin and Fujiko talking, and falls for him. But her father scolds her and tells her to stay away from thieves, but Francoise devises a plan to approach Lupin anyway…

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Professor Pancho has devoted his life to solving the problem of food supply. Lupin decides to help them out and invents a rocket that flies on corn fuel, thinking that maybe he and Fujiko will take a trip to the moon…

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin is blackmailed; Fujiko has been kidnapped, and for ransom he must steal a jeweled crown worth 100 million dollars. Lupin and friends head to the museum where their objective lies.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lady Black and Fujiko have a bet. Whoever kills Lupin will get the loser's entire jewelry collection. Lady Black lures Lupin using Fujiko so she could kill him, but why is she so passionate about wanting him dead?
programme.sub-title: Take Lupin All The Way to Hell

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Boss Largo wants Lupin dead; Lupin had just stolen a bundle of the boss's casino profits. But no run of the mill hitman would suffice to wack Lupin. But Largo sees that Lupin is suffering from a toothache, and gets an idea.
programme.sub-title: The Direct Attack! Dead Ball Strategy

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin reads the morning paper, which says that Lupin stole a 100-karat diamond that was being used in a musical. He knows he didn't do it, so he asks Fujiko and others, but they too have no idea what it's all about.
programme.sub-title: Lupin and An Old Woman's Scheme

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The nation of Janaica is troubled with coup d'etats and revolutions, but Lupin, discovering that the president's mansion houses the missing painting "Nude Venus," decides to go scope the joint with Jigen.
programme.sub-title: The Kindness Of Jigen is Seen

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The master of surrealism, Monsieur Daré had spent three years working on his masterpiece, but news is out that the great object of art got stolen.
programme.sub-title: Lupin vs The Man of Two Faces

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Three incidents of bank robbery have happened; a total of 1.3 billion yen was stolen. A man calling himself Goemon is the culprit and he even sends Lupin a challenge, but Goemon wants to settle the score by himself.
programme.sub-title: The Secret of Goemon's Zantetsu Sword

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin's stash of Napoleon's cash got stolen, but Lupin catches the culprit and tries to make him confess. Turns out he's only one of the followers of the Fandar cult, and heads to their holy land of Fandara.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin learns that a treasure trove lies in a volcano on Cleo Island, but it can only be reached when the mountain isn't spewing molten lava! He tries to convince Jigen and Goemon to join him but they're not interested.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Fujiko informs Lupin that fine quality diamonds from South Africa are stored in a safe of a global syndicate and importer of diamonds. Lupin makes his way as a worker in the boiler room, and steals the loot of diamonds.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin finds out about the jewel "Poison Trio" of the Borges family and decides to steal it after Fujiko goads him. Galdan, the nephew of Lucricia greets Lupin, and tells him that elderly Lucricia had been arrested and must be broken out of jail.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin goes on a safe-cracking rampage and rakes in 10 million francs. He needs the money to purchase the world's only rare Gold Butterfly at an auction. But Lupin drops the 10 million francs while on the run…

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin scopes a jewelry museum where the billion-dollar gem Cleopatra's Tear is displayed. But Lupin can't get to it because the display case is secured by high-voltage electricity.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: No thief has ever succeeded in stealing the secret gem of Pompeii's nunnery; it's guarded by venomous snakes. Even Arsene Lupin gave up on it, since he hates snakes. But Lupin takes on the challenge. Will Lupin succeed? And what kind of secret gem is it?

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Though the tycoon Steel had replaced all his bodily organs with artificial organs to live, he's told that he only has a week to live. There is only one way he could prolong his life, which is to receive a brain transplant and he wants Lupin's Brain.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Famous gourmand and field mice scientist Salmon Whitney is also known as being the chairman of a Canadian diamond mining operation. Lupin is after his diamonds, which will go on auction in Paris.
programme.sub-title: The Wolf Runs and the Pig Rolls

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Coaxed by Fujiko, Lupin decides to steal the diamond chandelier at the Kremlin Palace. He disguises himself as Zenigata and infiltrates the palace, but government police soldier Natasha captures him and throws him in the slammer.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: England's Lord Weather provokes Lupin with a bet, and dares him to steal Red Arrow away from him. Lupin takes the challenge as it's a matter of pride, but Jigen wants no part of it because he and Weather are gambling buddies.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Miami Bank is on the verge of bankruptcy after its last customers closed their accounts. The bank manager Garlic devises a plan to revive the bank, and drums up news that his bank had been raided by Lupin; he also asks Lupin to really do it.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Thief brothers Nanja-Monja have been in the business since the days of Arsène Lupin; they decide to induct Lupin as a tourist attraction for the Republic of Karchina. But first they abduct Fujiko.
programme.sub-title: Hair Breadth Rescue Operation for Fujiko

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Fujiko joins Lupin and gang who are camping and cooking Sukiyaki; people are hunting Fujiko, and gunfire is exchanged. Fujiko gets captured and Lupin's Sukiyaki meal gets ruined, but he finds an atomic bomb's detonator plug inside of the Sukiyaki bowl.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Genius prodigy boy Romanoff has ten doctorates from Russia's Public Academy; blustering that no greater than he exists, he challenges Lupin. Since Fujiko is involved, Lupin cannot back down; what will become of this challenge?

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Fujiko is the model for Norway's famous sculptor Vingel's crystal mermaid statue; she believed when he said he would give it to her the day it was finished, but Vingel gets greedy and sells it to the mayor of the city of Bergen instead.
programme.sub-title: The Mermaid That Disappears in the Midnight Sun

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin tries to steal a bunch of diamonds from a diamond auction. But the auction auditorium is at the Marine Tower above a skyscraper, and there is only one transparent elevator to get there.
programme.sub-title: The Target is Five Hundred and Fifty Five Meters Away

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin heads to Mecca to steal Mohammed's treasure. But first he is confronted by Patra Lawrence, the grandaughter of the Lawrence of Arabia, who is the chief of Mecca's special police headquarters; how will Lupin steal the treasure now?

programme.title: Underworld, (2003, Science fiction)
programme.desc: In the Underworld, Vampires are a secret clan of modern aristocratic sophisticates whose mortal enemies are the Lycans (werewolves), a shrewd gang of street thugs who prowl the city's underbelly.

programme.title: Underworld: Evolution, (2006, Blockbusters)
programme.desc: Vampire death dealer, Selene (Kate Beckinsale) fights to end the eternal war between the Lycan clan and the Vampire faction that betrayed her.

programme.title: Underworld Awakening, (2011, Blockbusters)
programme.desc: When human forces discover the existence of the Vampire and Lycan clans, a war to eradicate both species commences. The vampire warrioress Selene leads the battle against humankind.

programme.title: Underworld: Blood Wars, (2016, Blockbusters)
programme.desc: As the war between the Death Dealers and the Lycans rages on, Selene (Beckinsale), the vampire warrior, and Michael (Speedman), the werewolf hybrid, work together in an effort to unlock the secrets of their respective bloodlines.

programme.title: Season of the Witch, (2011, Fantasy)
programme.desc: A 14th-century Crusader returns to a homeland devastated by the Black Plague. A beleaguered church commands the knight to transport an accused witch to a remote abbey, where monks will perform a ritual in hopes of ending the pestilence.

programme.title: Timecop, (1994, Science fiction)
programme.desc: Max Walker, an officer for a security agency that regulates time travel, must fend for his life against a shady politician who's intent on changing the past to control the future.

programme.title: Universal Soldier, (1992, Science fiction)
programme.desc: A woman reporter discovers a Defense Department project to create androids from the bodies of Vietnam soldiers, to be then used as an elite anti-terrorism unit.

programme.title: The Lazarus Effect, (2015, Horror)
programme.desc: A group of medical researchers discover a way to bring dead patients back to life.

programme.title: Gunsight Ridge, (1957, Drama)
programme.desc: Stage line agent investigates a series of robberies by taking the job of a deputy sheriff in a border Arizona town.

programme.title: Support Your Local Sheriff!, (1969, Drama)
programme.desc: James Garner stars in this rollicking western spoof that has him taking on the job of a frontier town sheriff who must fend off villains (led by Walter Brennen) from every direction...all without breaking a sweat or dirtying his shiny black boots!

programme.title: Support Your Local Gunfighter, (1971, Drama)
programme.desc: James Garner is back in the saddle again as hustler Latigo Smith whose latest con is passing off cowhand Jug (Jack Elam) as the dreaded gunman Swifty Morgan. But when the real Swifty shows up, the Wild West is going to get a whole lot wackier!

programme.title: Last Train From Gun Hill, (1959, Drama)
programme.desc: Screen giants Kirk Douglas and Anthony Quinn star in this taut Western thriller directed by acclaimed filmmaker John Sturges (Gunfight at the O.K. Corral, The Great Escape).

programme.title: The Horse Soldiers, (1959, Western)
programme.desc: John Wayne, Constance Towers and William Holden star in this 1863, fact-based story about a Union mission to destroy a railroad junction deep within Confederate territory.

programme.title: Indian Territory, (1950, Drama)
programme.desc: Following the Civil War, Cavalry Sergeant Gene Autry is sent to break up a series of Indian raids upon settlers, led by a renegade Austrian, who wishes to use the Indians to build an empire.

programme.title: Mule Train, (1950, Drama)
programme.desc: When natural cement is discovered by two prospectors, one is murdered during a claim jump attempt. Marshal Gene Autry befriends the lone prospector and tries to help him promote his cement discovery.

programme.title: Oklahoma!, (1955, Drama)
programme.desc: In Oklahoma, several farmers, cowboys and a traveling salesman compete for the romantic favors of various local ladies.

programme.title: The White Buffalo, (1977, Drama)
programme.desc: Charles Bronson and Will Sampson star as Wild Bill Hickok and Chief Crazy Horse in this one-of-a-kind western that finds both western legends braving the snowy wilderness in search of the demon that haunts them both, the fabled White Buffalo!

programme.title: Duel at Diablo, (1966, Drama)
programme.desc: Frontier scout Jess Remsberg leads a wagon train through hostile territory to Fort Conchos. But underneath his valor, he has an ulterior motive: to settle a score with the man he believes killed his wife. James Garner and Sidney Poitier star.

programme.title: The Ring, (2002, Horror)
programme.desc: When four teenagers all meet with mysterious deaths exactly one week after watching a videotape, investigative reporter Rachel Keller tracks down the video... and watches it.

programme.title: The Ring Two, (2005, Horror)
programme.desc: When evidence at a local crime scene reveals a mysterious unmarked videotape, Rachel realizes that Samara is back and more determined than ever to continue her relentless cycle of terror.

programme.title: Cloverfield, (2007, Science fiction)
programme.desc: Five young New Yorkers face a life or death struggle in order to escape from the city when a monster the size of a skyscraper suddenly appears.

programme.title: Vacancy, (2007, Horror)
programme.desc: A suspenseful, classic thriller, in the tradition of Alfred Hitchcock, starring Luke Wilson and Kate Beckinsale, that will keep you on the edge of your seat and your heart pounding! Rated: R

programme.title: Pulse, (2006, Horror)
programme.desc: When their computer hacker friend accidentally channels a mysterious wireless signal, a group of co-eds rally to stop a terrifying evil from taking over the world.

programme.desc: When four teenagers all meet with mysterious deaths exactly one week after watching a videotape, investigative reporter Rachel Keller tracks down the video... and watches it.

programme.desc: When evidence at a local crime scene reveals a mysterious unmarked videotape, Rachel realizes that Samara is back and more determined than ever to continue her relentless cycle of terror.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Usagi and her friends are enjoying the cherry blossoms when the Cardian Leshy attacks. The Sailor Guardians are caught.

programme.desc: Usagi and Mamoru find themselves looking after a baby boy while his mother is recovering from having her energy stolen by a Cardian.

programme.desc: Ami and Makoto are trying to figure out who the Moonlight Knight is. Makoto volunteers to investigate by getting closer to Seijuro.

programme.desc: Usagi and Natsumi both get detention after angering Ms. Haruna during class. The two start working on their assignment when a Cardian shows up.

programme.desc: Ail and An learn that the Makai Tree is beginning to die. Usagi and her friends visit Natsumi after hearing that Natsumi is not feeling well.

programme.desc: While visiting Seijuro and Natsumi's apartment, Usagi and Mamoru come under attack by the Makai Tree.

programme.desc: A mysterious girl suddenly falls down from the sky. Calling herself 'Usagi,' the girl demands Usagi to tell her where the Silver Crystal is.
programme.sub-title: Angel or Devil? The Mysterious Girl from the Sky

programme.desc: Usagi wakes up to find that Chibi-Usa has gone missing. Meeting up with Mamoru, the two search for Chibi-Usa, finding her alone at the park.
programme.sub-title: Usagi Devastated: Mamoru Declares a Break-Up

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Ami is offered a chance to study abroad in Germany. Knowing how important this is to her, Usagi and the others urge Ami to accept the offer.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Rei's grandfather is upset that Hikawa Shrine has had fewer female visitors lately. He then decides to retire as head priest to start a new business.

programme.desc: Rubeus sends down Petz and her Droid to search and capture Chibi-Usa. Chibi-Usa is calling someone telling her she wants to go home.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Chibi-Usa's class is having a parent-child curry party. After hearing that neither Kenji nor Ikuko can attend, Usagi decides to go in their place.
programme.sub-title: Usagi's Parental Love: The Curry Romance Triangle

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: The girls enjoy some vacation time on an island. Chibi-Usa and Rei get into a small fight, causing an angry Chibi-Usa to go out to the sea alone.
programme.sub-title: The Beach, the Island and a Vacation: The Guardians' Break

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Chibi-Usa leaves the house after being scolded by Usagi. Chibi-Usa begins to cry, which draws the attention of Rubeus and the Four Spectre Sisters.
programme.sub-title: Protect Chibi-Usa: Clash of the Ten Warriors

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Mamoru has a dream which a voice warns him that being with Usagi will bring her great misfortune. Meanwhile, Sailor Moon is attacked by a Droid.
programme.sub-title: Awaken the Sleeping Beauty: Mamoru's Distress

programme.desc: Wiseman predicts that Chibi-Usa will appear at Hikawa Shrine. Learning of this, Rubeus orders Koan to go down there and eliminate their target.

programme.title: Sobrenatural: A Última Chave
